intro: Croton erythroxyloides var. longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved croton, is a species native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. The leaves and fruits are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
